intro: Octomeria dentifera, commonly known as the toothed octomeris, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
